body.p:
Lexington Ky
Aug 29th /64
Gov. of Kentucky
Gov Bramlette

I wish to ask a fiew questions of you as it has been the great point of argument for the Officers, whether we will be held in the service three years from the date of last muster or not. I enlisted in this Company the 20th of Sept 1861 and have served as an enlisted man eversince up to the 14th of last June when I was commishioned by you as 1st Lt. Co (I") 1st Ky. Cav. I have never been mustered yet as Lt, and if that be the Order I had rather abandon my pos as Lt than to be mustered, if there is any such Order I wish to know the date of it, I onely enlisted for three years
and when the Regt is mustered out I wish to be too as I have not been mustered (if that be the order) I will not be I had rather doe without my Lt wages and be mustered out with the Regt as an enlisted man.

You Most Obedient Servt.
Lt. Thos. J. Graves.
Co. (I")1st. Ky. Cav.

1 Cav
Lexington Ky
Aug 29th 1864
Graves. Thos. J. 1st Lt. Co "I" 1st Ky. Cav.
To Governor

Desires to know when his Reg't will be mustered out. Says he was mustered in as private 20th Sept. /61 and served as such up to 14th June 1864. when he recd comn as 1st Lt. Co. "I." 1st Ky. Cav. Has never been mustd on his comn If he will not be mustd out at the same time of his reg't -- if he is mustd on his Comn he would prefer not being mustd on it -- and being mustd out with Reg't as a private.

L B. No 6. 1864 P. 149
Recd A. G. O. 30th Aug. 1864.
